basics.name: Alvin Edrada
basics.label: Computer Science Student @ University of Hawaii
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2023.

courses: ICS 111 - Introduction to Computer Science I (Java Programming)
ICS 211 - Introduction to Computer Science II (Data Structures)

highlights: Built a scalable office hoteling web application for 200+ users with a development team.
Developed REST APIs in Python incorporating AWS Lambda and API Gateway to establish communication between users, databases, and other AWS Cloud technologies (SQS, SES, S3).
Improved user experience through reducing load and wait times by designing and developing recurring reservation features using Python and PostgreSQL.
Created and redesigned web and mobile friendly pages that called the backend to display info.
Increased stability of app by developing automated API tests using Postman.
Planned pages and workflows through whiteboarding collaboration sessions with team.
Integrated agile project management methods through daily scrums and JIRA boards to stay organized and flexible during the development process.
Presented and demoed project to audiences during company-wide gatherings.
Utilized: Python, AWS (Lambda, API Gateway, CodePipeline, CloudWatch, SQS, SES, S3), PostgreSQL, TypeScript, Angular, Material UI, HTML/SCSS, Git, Postman, Full stack Development, Agile
Refined and improved app for a mobile rainbow prediction and weather app by refactoring legacy code in Dart/Flutter and Python.
Improved performance through reducing payloads and supporting queuing to API calls in Python.
Enhanced user experience by adding guidelines and instructions to the primary map.
Utilized geocoding libraries to support location switching throughout the app and built a location switching menu using Dart and Flutter.
Expanded map support by adding and testing 50+ locales and 150+ radar stations to app database.
Utilized: Dart, Flutter, Python, Flask, Redis, Git, Android Development, JSON
